answers.answer: Monday-Friday between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., you can call the Help-line of the Romanian Government for information about the rights and services that refugees can benefit from throughout their stay in Romania at this number: +40 213 456 789.
answers.bResponse: Monday-Friday between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., you can call the Help-line of the Romanian Government for information about the rights and services that refugees can benefit from throughout their stay in Romania at this number: +40 213 456 789. answers.answer: They provide medical support and HIV treatment or services for those coming from Ukraine. They also offer support and guidance to refugees arriving in Romania and suffering from rare diseases.
answers.bResponse: They provide medical support and HIV treatment or services for those coming from Ukraine. They also offer support and guidance to refugees arriving in Romania and suffering from rare diseases. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center

answers.answer: Access to HIV treatment or services is available for those coming from Ukraine. Those seeking support for rare diseases can contact The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania in collaboration with EURORDIS - Rare Diseases Europe. Refugees arriving in Romania and suffering from rare diseases can also benefit from this support.

answers.answer: For more information on HIV treatment and services for refugees coming from Ukraine, please contact Sens Pozitiv at +40 744 682 225. Additionally, The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania collaborates with EURORDIS - Rare Diseases Europe to provide support and guidance to refugees with rare diseases upon arrival in Romania. You can reach them through Dorica Dan (+40 726 248 707) or Ukrainian-speaking Svetleska Yulia (+40 746 347 589).

answers.answer: Yes, I can provide information on contacting the Migration and Asylum Office in the Republic of Moldova. The office can be reached 24/7 through their helpline number, which is +373 60574848 or by email at [email protected] Additionally, they offer legal assistance services through the Law Center of Moldova, another available option for those seeking support.
